title.narrative: Emergency Response to Consequences of Hostilities Affecting Palestine Refugees in Gaza

description.narrative:
With this project, UNRWA are responding to the needs of Palestine refugees directly impacted by the hostilities, as follows: 1) Addressing the heightened need for mental health and psychosocial support (MHPSS) especially for children. Having witnessed death and injury, damage or loss of property, Gazans – especially children - face trauma and require psychosocial support, with coping mechanisms already eroded by years of blockade and previous experiences of violence. 2) Addressing the immediate need for shelter support to Palestine refugee families, whose shelters endured major damage. UNRWA will assess damaged shelters and provide transitional cash assistance, which consists of a portion to cover rental costs for up to 6 months and another to cover the cost of home essentials to help families settle while their shelters are under repair.
The project targets 3,000 affected people with the Education in Emergencies engagement and 150,000 affected people with its Emergency Shelter/Non-Food Items engagement.
